content.description: A curve in the <math alttext="x y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-plane is defined by the equation <math alttext="x cubed, plus y squared, minus 12 x, plus 16 y, equals 28 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>12</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>16</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>28</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following statements are true?
content.question: At points where <math alttext="x equals, negative 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, the lines tangent to the curve are horizontal.At points where <math alttext="y equals, negative 8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, the lines tangent to the curve are vertical.The line tangent to the curve at the point <math alttext="with coordinates negative 1, comma 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>1</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> has slope <math alttext="one half" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
